title: Wallet Wizardry Final Exam
description: Test your mastery of wallet security, setup, and best practices

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a crypto wallet?

options.text: To store private keys that control crypto assets

questions.explanation: A crypto wallet stores private keys, not the actual cryptocurrency. The private key gives you control over your assets on the blockchain.

questions.text: Which type of wallet is considered more secure for long-term storage?
questions.explanation: Hardware wallets (cold wallets) are more secure because they keep private keys offline and are not connected to the internet.

questions.text: What is the most secure way to store your seed phrase?

options.text: Written down offline and stored in multiple secure locations

questions.explanation: Storing your seed phrase offline on paper in multiple secure locations is the most secure method.

questions.text: What should you do if you receive an unsolicited DM promising free crypto?

options.text: Share your seed phrase to verify
Ignore it and report as spam

questions.explanation: Unsolicited offers of free crypto are almost always scams. Never connect your wallet or share private information.

questions.text: What is the first step in setting up MetaMask?
questions.explanation: The first step is to install the MetaMask browser extension or mobile app.

questions.text: What is a common sign of a phishing website?

options.text: Slightly misspelled URL of a legitimate service

questions.explanation: Scammers often use URLs that are very similar to legitimate ones, hoping users won't notice the slight difference.
Multi-signature wallets require multiple private keys to approve transactions, adding an extra layer of security.

questions.text: What should you always do before connecting your wallet to a dApp?

options.text: Verify the website URL and reputation

questions.explanation: Always verify the website URL and check the dApp's reputation before connecting your wallet.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a testnet?

options.text: To test dApps without using real funds

questions.explanation: Testnets allow you to test dApps and transactions without using real cryptocurrency or risking real funds.

questions.text: What is the best practice for wallet security?

options.text: Keep all funds in one wallet
Diversify across multiple wallets and use strong security measures

questions.explanation: Diversifying across multiple wallets and using strong security measures like hardware wallets and multi-sig is the best practice.
